title: LLMs + Security = Trouble
description: ArXiv paper (2602.08422) discusses challenges in enforcing security constraints during code generation with LLMs. The paper examines security vulnerabilities and risks when using AI coding assistants.
author: ArXiv

title: Andrej Karpathy introduces 'agentic engineering' as new AI coding paradigm
description: Andrej Karpathy, inventor of 'vibe coding', introduces 'agentic engineering' as his latest concept. He argues that directing AI agents—not writing code—now defines modern software development. This represents an evolution from his earlier work on 'vibe coding' and reflects the rapid shift in how experienced developers are approaching AI-assisted programming.
author: Andrej Karpathy

title: Databricks CEO says SaaS isn't dead, but AI will soon make it irrelevant
description: Databricks CEO discusses how AI will transform the SaaS landscape and potentially make traditional SaaS applications irrelevant. The conversation touches on AI's impact on developer tools and the future of software delivery.
author: TechCrunch

title: How StrongDM's AI team build serious software without even looking at the code
description: Simon Willison reports on StrongDM's AI team implementing 'Dark Factory' level AI adoption where no human reviews code. The team uses 'Software Factories' with non-interactive development where specs + scenarios drive agents. Key innovations include Digital Twin Universe (cloning services like Okta, Jira, Slack for testing), scenario-based testing as holdout sets, and the rule that code must not be written or reviewed by humans. The team reports spending $1,000/day per engineer on tokens.
author: Simon Willison

title: OpenAI Frontier is a single platform to control your AI agents
description: The Verge reports on OpenAI's new Frontier platform, which provides unified management for AI agents. The platform aims to simplify the control and orchestration of multiple AI agents in development workflows.
author: The Verge

title: Claude has been having a moment — can it keep it up?
description: The Verge examines Anthropic's Claude AI and its growing popularity in the coding space. The article discusses Claude Code and Opus, examining whether Claude's current momentum in AI-assisted programming is sustainable.
author: The Verge

title: FullStack-Agent: Enhancing Agentic Full-Stack Web Coding
description: ArXiv paper (2602.03798) presents a system for assisting non-expert users in developing interactive websites using LLM-powered code agents. The paper demonstrates advances in full-stack development automation.
author: ArXiv

title: Loyalty Is Dead in Silicon Valley
description: WIRED's Model Behavior newsletter reports on the 'great unbundling' of tech startups, where founders and early employees rapidly move between companies. The article describes massive AI acqui-hires: Meta invested $14B in Scale AI, Google spent $2.4B on Windsurf, Nvidia wagered $20B on Groq. The frontier AI labs are playing 'talent musical chairs' with researchers moving between OpenAI, Anthropic, and others. Founders are trading idealism for pragmatism as AI innovation accelerates, with compensation packages in the tens or hundreds of millions.
author: Lauren Goode

title: State of AI in 2026: LLMs, Coding, Scaling Laws, China, Agents, GPUs, AGI
description: Lex Fridman discusses the current state of AI with Nathan Lambert and Sebastian Raschka. Topics include LLMs, coding assistants, scaling laws, AI agents, GPU availability, and progress toward AGI. The conversation covers how AI coding tools are evolving and the future of programming with AI assistance.
author: Lex Fridman, Nathan Lambert, Sebastian Raschka

title: OpenAI launches new agentic coding model only minutes after Anthropic drops its own
description: TechCrunch reports on OpenAI's release of a new agentic coding model, announced just minutes after Anthropic's competing model. The new model is designed to accelerate the capabilities of Codex, OpenAI's agentic coding tool. The competitive timing highlights the intense race in AI coding assistants.
author: TechCrunch

title: How to Work Effectively with Frontend and Backend Code
description: Towards Data Science publishes a guide on being an effective full-stack engineer with AI coding agents. The article covers specific day-to-day techniques and best practices for integrating AI tools into full-stack development workflows.
author: Towards Data Science

title: ProjDevBench: Benchmarking AI Coding Agents on End-to-End Project Development
description: ArXiv paper (2602.01655) introduces a new benchmark evaluating six different coding agents built on various LLM backends for end-to-end project development. The benchmark assesses how well AI agents can complete entire development projects.
author: ArXiv

title: So yeah, I vibe-coded a log colorizer—and I feel good about it
description: Lee Hutchinson of Ars Technica shares his personal experience using Claude Code to 'vibe code' a custom Nginx log colorizer to debug a WordPress/Discourse/Cloudflare caching race condition. The article provides an honest assessment of LLM coding agents: fantastic when you understand the problem domain and can spot hallucinations, but dangerous when stepping outside your expertise. The author successfully identifies a race condition with Apple News bots but also encounters limitations when the LLM attempts solutions beyond appropriate boundaries.
author: Lee Hutchinson

title: Will AI replace programmers?
description: Lex Fridman Podcast episode featuring Nathan Lambert and Sebastian Raschka discussing whether AI will replace programmers. The conversation explores the current capabilities of AI coding tools and their limitations.
author: Lex Fridman, Nathan Lambert, Sebastian Raschka

title: Xcode moves into agentic coding with deeper OpenAI and Anthropic integrations
description: Apple announces Xcode 26.3 with significant agentic coding capabilities, allowing developers to use Claude Agent and OpenAI's tools directly within the IDE. This marks Apple's deeper integration of AI coding assistants into mainstream development workflows.
author: TechCrunch
